title: How, and why, you should play Ability power ezreal nowadays.
body:
https://images.duckduckgo.com/iu/?u=http%3A%2F%2Ftse1.mm.bing.net%2Fth%3Fid%3DOIP.Macb142daf497f60fe0ddeb625fe27769o0%26pid%3D15.1&f=1
__________________________________________________________________________________________
Bruisers...
Tanks...
ADCs...
APCs...

These four roles lived together in "Harmony". Not totally, because people died here and there, but whatever. 
Then...
The ADC faction attacked.

Only the manyrole, master of all four roles, could stop them. ({{champion:78}}) 
But when the world needed her most... she vanished.

Many patches later, my friends and I discovered the new manyrole, Ezreal. Although his AD are great, it won't do a whole lot to change a game. He has a lot to try, and learn...

But... I believe Ezreal can save the world.

__________________________________________________________________________________________

Okay, now that I have that HORRIBLE intro out of the way, let's get to it. Ezreal is a versatile champion, and a whooole lot of people play him attack damage. Well, thing is, that makes his W useless, and his Q, R, an E miss out on damage if you build him...
AP.

Now, The reason I have no tank items below is because, well, have you SEEN the friggin' damage the ADCs do nowadays?
Yeah. Anyways, onto the build.

START:
{{item:1052}} {{item:2003}}, {{item:3340}} 

ANY ORDER, ANY ITEM:
{{item:3041}} {{item:3100}}(Get me in your first four items!) Both{{item:3070}}items, {{item:3089}} {{item:3285}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3165}} {{item:3152}} {{item:3158}} 

REASONING:
{{item:3041}}: I dunno, get it if you're feeling confident or somethin'.

{{item:3100}}: Q = Spell is cast.
Q applies on-hit effects. 'nuff said.

BOTH{{item:3070}} items: Because they compliment eachother with their passives.
Always have the {{item:3042}} active on.

{{item:3089}}: Just a really great item, I love it.

{{item:3285}}: The PSHEW passive thingie works on anything that's not your Q, highly recommended.

{{item:3115}}: Not only does it make your Q have a higher ratio, it makes your basic attacks not useless. Also gives you CDR.

{{item:3165}}: To top off that CDR. And grevious wounds.

{{item:3158}} {{item:3152}}: Get these two together if you want max CDR with that nashor's tooth, and want summa dat spell vamp.


GAMEPLAY:
Now, laning phase might be a little difficult, but hear me out. Just poke enemy with Q, and last hit.
That's all. ONLY go in for the kill if you know for a fact you can kill.
Be sure to gank, not push tower, if you're winning lane. And someone nearby is losing lane.
Later game, start roaming for a bit at a time until lategame comes rolling.
Then you'll roll all their faces into the ground.

RUNES AND MASTERIES:
RUNES:
.......Look at my runes. LOOK AT THEM!
DO I LOOK LIKE I CARE?!

MASTERIES:
Deathfire touch, all AP things you can get your hands on, and biscuits.

Okay, I'm done. Thank you for taking your time to read this... Moderate guide.
I wish all of you good luck.
